Information regarding School Catering and the nutritional guidelines

We will:

  • Provide a fully inclusive two course meal for a set price each day, in line with National Nutritional Standards.
  • Provide a choice of menu items to select from.
  • Provide dishes which are both nutritious and excellent value for money.
  • Provide dishes which are prepared by qualified catering staff using high quality products.
  • Provide a safe working environment in which to dine.

You can help us by:

  • Speaking to us, the Headteacher or any of the School Governors about any of the problems you have, or any suggestions you have for the improvement of our service.
  • Coming into school on a pre-arranged appointment to see for yourself the service being provided.
  • Letting us know if you have any special dietary needs.

You can get in touch with us using the details above.

Details of Free School Meals link to pid 4 are available.

The standards say that lunches for primary school pupils must contain at least one item from each of the following food groups

Standard No

Standard
1 Starchy foods such as bread, potatoes, rice and pasta. Starchy foods cooked in oil or fat should not be served more than three times a week
2 Fruit and a vegetable must be available every day. Fruit based desserts must be available twice a week
3 Milk and dairy foods.
4 Meat, fish and alternative sources of protein including cheese. Red meat must be served twice a week. Fish must be served at least once per week.

Plus

Additional Recommendations
a Drinking water should be available to all pupils every day, free of charge
b Schools should offer some hot food, particularly in the winter
c Drinking Milk should be available as an option every day

For more information regarding this subject, please contact us using the details above.
